# MultipleExponents

*Both Alice and Bob share the same modulus, but with different exponents. If only there was some way I could recover this message that was sent to both of them.*

---

题目中给出了n,e1,e2,c1,c2的值,这里可以利用[RSA共模攻击](https://ctf-wiki.org/crypto/asymmetric/rsa/rsa_module_attack/#_7)

```python
import gmpy2
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes

data = {'n': , 'e1': 11048796690938982746152432997911442334648615616780223415034610235310401058533076125720945559697433984697892923155680783661955179131565701195219010273246901, 'e2': 9324711814017970310132549903114153787960184299541815910528651555672096706340659762220635996774790303001176856753572297256560097670723015243180488972016453,
        'c1': , 'c2': }
n = data['n']
e1 = data['e1']
e2 = data['e2']
message1 = data['c1']
message2 = data['c2']

# s & t
gcd, s, t = gmpy2.gcdext(e1, e2)
if s < 0:
    s = -s
    message1 = gmpy2.invert(message1, n)
if t < 0:
    t = -t
    message2 = gmpy2.invert(message2, n)
plain = gmpy2.powmod(message1, s, n) * gmpy2.powmod(message2, t, n) % n
print(plain)
print(long_to_bytes(plain).decode('utf-8'))
```

**flag:**`sun{d0n7_d0_m0r3_th4n_0ne_3xp0n3nt}`
